externalDocs.description: The SuperOffice DevNet Community has more documentation, examples, and discussion forums.

SuperOffice_Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId_Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketMessageEn.description:
The ticket messages are e-mails, SMS or other messages attached to a ticket (aka request).

MessageCategory.description: Defines what kind of message this is.

MessageHeaders.description: Contains the message headers, like To, Cc, Bcc information, or custom headers

Language.description: The language this message is in, based on some kind of analysis

Sentiment.description: Sentiment index, 100 = completely happy; -100 = suicidally unhappy; 0 = no idea

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Ticket.description:
The ticket carrier is used for representing a service request.
<para />
Carrier object for Ticket.
Services for the Ticket Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ITicketAgent">Ticket Agent</see>.

LastChanged.description: The last time the ticket was modified.

ReadByOwner.description: The datetime for when the ticket last was read by the owner.

ReadByCustomer.description: The datetime for when the ticket was read by the customer.

FirstReadByUser.description: The datetime for when the ticket first was read by a user.

Activate.description: When the ticket should be activated, if it is postponed.

RepliedAt.description: The datetime for when the ticket was replied to. I.e. the first external message added to the ticket.

AlertTimeout.description: The datetime for when the ticket should jump to the next alert_level.

CreatedBy.description: The id of the user who created the ticket. 1 (system user) if the ticket was created externally

CreatedByName.description: Initials, also login name, possibly database user name

Author.description: A string representing the author of the ticket (same as author of first message).

OwnedBy.description: The id of the user who owns the ticket. 1 (system user) if the ticket is unassigned.

OwnedByName.description: Initials, also login name, possibly database user name

Category.description: The id of the category a ticket is in.

CategoryName.description: The (short) name of this category. E.g. &apos;support&apos;.

CategoryFullname.description: The fullname (compiled from parents&apos; names) for this category. E.g. &apos;norway/product A/support&apos;.

Priority.description: The reference to the ticket_priority table.

BaseStatus.description: The status of the ticket. I.e. active/closed/postponed/deleted

TicketStatusDisplayValue.description: Get the display name of the ticket status.

Origin.description: What is the origin of this ticket

CustId.description: The reference to the customer. NULL or -1 if ticket is not connected to customer.

PersonFullname.description: Get the full name for the primary person (customer)

AlertLevel.description: The alert level for the ticket. Matches the level value of the ticket_alert table.

ConnectId.description: If a ticket is connected to another ticket, this field is set to the id of the &apos;master&apos; ticket.

ReadStatus.description: Whether the owner has read the ticket or not (red, yellow, green).

TimeToReply.description: The time (minutes) between when the ticket was created and when it was replied to. Calculated based on priority&apos;s timeframe.

RealTimeToReply.description: Same as time_to_reply, but not calculated based on priority.

TimeToClose.description: The time (minutes) between when the ticket was created and when it was closed. Calculated based on priority&apos;s timeframe.

RealTimeToClose.description: Same as time_to_close, but not calculated based on priority.

TimeSpentInternally.description: The total time (seconds) within the priority's office hours the ticket has been in an open status (configurable), not including current state

TimeSpentExternally.description: The total time (seconds) within the priority's office hours the ticket has been in a external waiting status (configurable), not including current state

TimeSpentQueue.description: The total time (seconds) within the priority's office hours the ticket has been in a queue status, not including current state

RealTimeSpentInternally.description: The total time (seconds) within 24x7 the ticket has been in an open status (configurable), not including current state

RealTimeSpentExternally.description: The total time (seconds) within 24x7 the ticket has been in a external waiting status (configurable), not including current state

RealTimeSpentQueue.description: The total time (seconds) within 24x7 hours the ticket has been in a queue status, not including current state

TimeSpent.description: The total time (minutes). Aggregated time spent from ticket&apos;s messages. Read-only for external use.

HasAttachment.description: Boolean indicating if this ticket has one or more attachments.

NumReplies.description: The number of replies (messages) to the customer for this request.

NumMessages.description: The total number of messages for this request.

FromAddress.description: The from-address used when this ticket got created, e.g. by email

ContactId.description: The company of the person in the cust_id field, if that person belongs to a company

ContactName.description: The name of the connected contact

OwnedByAssociateId.description: The associate id of the owner of the ticket.

Language.description: The language of the first external message

Sentiment.description: The sentiment index of the last external message

SentimentConfidence.description: The sentiment confidence of the last external message

SaleHeading.description: The heading of the connected sale

ProjectName.description: The name of the connected project

FormSubmissionId.description: If this ticket was created from a form submission, this field will point to that record

TicketTypeId.description: The id of the Request Type

TicketTypeName.description: The name of the Request Type

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

DefaultTicketStatus.description: Default ticket status for new tickets

DefaultTicketPriority.description: Default ticket priority for new tickets

IsDefault.description: Is this Ticket Type marked as default

ShowInNew.description: Enables this request type to be accessible in +New in top bar

ExcludeSignature.description: Do not insert user signature automatically

ExcludeEmailRecipients.description: Create request without initially having to send outbound e-mail

ExternalAsDefault.description: Ability to set external access level for this request type

VisibleForGroups.description: Array of references to the visible for groups

ReplyForwardNoSignature.description: Do not insert user signature when replying or forwarding the message

ReplyExternalAsDefault.description: Set external access level when replying the message

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.TicketCar.description: GetForRmUi: Get a ticket entity, adapted to the specific needs of the Request Management UI. WARNING: This endpoint is not guaranteed to be stable/compatible between versions
DeleteTicketEntity: Delete a ticket
NotifyNewTicket: Notify user agents about the creation of a new ticket
NotifyNewTicketMessage: Notify user agents about the creation of a new message on a ticket
GetTicketAttachments: Get attachment infos for all attachments connected to messages in specified ticket
ValidateAttachments: Check attachments, return validation result for each item

IsValid.description: Indicates if the attachment is valid

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.TicketCar.description: SetTicketReadByOwner: Set the ReadByOwner status for a ticket. It will only have an effect if the calling user is the same as the owner of the ticket
SaveTicketEntityWithNotify: Saves a ticket and performs any user notifications

ProcessTicketWhenRead: When a user view/read a ticket, a number of action should be performed: set read status, escalation handling, remove notifications, etc. Which actions will be performed depends on owner, caller and configuration
SplitTicket: Save new ticket and move/copy data from existing ticket in a single request. Specified messages will be moved.
SplitTicketMessage: Create new ticket and move/copy data from existing ticket in addition update old message and save new message in a single request.
UpdateTicketsReadStatus: This method changes multiple tickets' read status
UpdateTicketsReadStatusByProvider: This method changes multiple tickets' read status

SuperOffice.CRM.ArchiveLists.ArchiveRest.description: This class carries information about a restriction on the query of an archive provider

Name.description: The programmatic column name, including any required prefixes

DisplayValues.description:
Display representation of value(s) - list ID's are decoded to display texts, other values are represented in a format
suitable for decoding and display through the {SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter}.

IsActive.description: Is this restriction active?  Inactive restrictions will not influence the generated query

SubRestrictions.description: Optional collection of sub criteria, usually null but set for Saint counter fields

InterParenthesis.description:
Get or set the parenthesis (if any) associated with this restriction. Positive values indicate a number
of opening parentheses (deepening nesting level), while negative numbers indicate closing parentheses.
Zero means no change in nesting level (no parentheses).

InterOperator.description:
Get or set the inter-restriction operator that describes how this
restriction is related to the next one in an array.
Default for new ArchiveRestrictionInfo objects is And

SuperOffice.CRM.ArchiveLists.ArchiveColu.description:
This class carries information about the definition and properties of an archive display column. It is used by the archive
MDO providers to construct column lists for the configuration dialogs, and by the archive control to know what type
(and other properties) each column has. The class is serializable and used on both the application
and Web server sides.

DisplayName.description: The column name to show, can be a resource identifier string

DisplayTooltip.description: The column tooltip, used in the column list and in the column headings

DisplayType.description:
Type of column, so that the archive knows how to display it (actual display values are always strings, invariant-culture formatted).
This name can contain resource tags.

CanOrderBy.description: Can this column be used for sorting?

Name.description:
Unique identity of this column (in this particular context); the name to be used when requesting the column from a provider,
setting restrictions or order by criteria

CanRestrictBy.description: Can this column be used as a restriction

RestrictionType.description: The data type of the restriction; use this to retrieve the legal operators for the restriction

RestrictionListName.description: If the restriction data type is 'list', this property contains the name of the SoList so that choices can be shown

IsVisible.description: Is this column visible to the user in configuration dialogs etc

ExtraInfo.description: Example: "navigator" -> Should this column be mapped to a hyperlinked navigator text type?

Width.description:
The width specification, if the column info has been extended with GUI-based information.
It is either "n%" or "nc", where n is an integer. Percent-formatted fields grow and shrink; number-of-characters
formatted fields have constant width when the whole archive width changes.

IconHint.description:
Icon hint corresponding to the display name; this icon hint is used in the configuration dialog
and other places where we 'talk about' the columns of the archive. The actual heading
of the archive may also contain icons in lieu of textual names, the icon hint for that
is specified in {SuperOffice.CRM.ArchiveLists.ArchiveColumnInfo.HeadingIconHint} and is a different one.

HeadingIconHint.description:
Icon hint for the archive heading only. If this is a nonempty string, the archive header
should use this icon and ignore the {SuperOffice.CRM.ArchiveLists.ArchiveColumnInfo.DisplayName}. Otherwise, the DisplayName
should be used as the heading.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.TicketCar.description: MergeTickets: Merge one or more tickets into one primary ticket
SetDeletedStatusByIds: Sets tickets' status to Deleted. After a grace period these tickets will be deleted by a background job.
SetDeletedStatusByProvider: Sets tickets' status to Deleted. After a grace period these tickets will be deleted by a background job.
UndeleteByIds: Restores deleted tickets by their ids. Status is set to a default open status defined in Registry table
ResolveTicketId: Ticket can be connected (merged) to another ticket. This method traverses through its connection(s) and returns proper ticketId
BatchForward: Forwards selected tickets to specified recipients. This method starts a batch task.
BatchReply: Replies to the specified tickets. This method starts a batch task.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketBatchRepl.description:
Data to add a batched ticket reply.
<para />
Carrier object for TicketBatchReplyData.
Services for the TicketBatchReplyData Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ITicketAgent">Ticket Agent</see>.

TicketIds.description: IDs of tickets to reply to.

CloseTickets.description: true to close the tickets after replying; otherwise, false.

AttachmentIds.description: The IDs of attachments to connect to the reply message.

HtmlBody.description: The html body for the message (if any).

TimeSpent.description: The time spent (minutes) for this message.

SendCopyToCustomer.description: true to email the reply message to customers; otherwise, false.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.TicketCar.description: ClearNotify: Clear notification status for one or more tickets.
GetTicketMessageEntities: Get ticket message entities with attachment info for given ticket
CreateDefaultForTicketType: Create default ticket entity for particular TicketType
DoEscalating: Checks if the ticket should change its alert level based on the priority and action. If it is to change, the alert level and alert timeout for the ticket will be updated.
GetHotlistEjUsers: Get a list of ej_user ids who should receive hotlist notification based on request and notification type
AcceptTickets: Accepts tickets by their ids. Sets owner to current user
DeleteTicketMessageEntity: Delete a ticket message
SanitizeMailContent: Remove harmful HTML tags and attributes from an email
SanitizeMailContentWithOptions: Remove harmful HTML tags and attributes from an email, using specified options
SanitizeMailContents: Remove harmful HTML tags and attributes from an email
Html2Text: Create a plain text version of the html, suitable for email
GetAttachmentInfo: Get a list with meta data for all attached attachments
GetAttachmentInfoNonInline: Get a list with meta data for all attached attachments, EXCEPT those marked as inline
AddAttachments: Connect existing attachments with this TicketMessage. Can connect multiple attachments
RemoveMessageAttachments: Removes attachments from the message as specified in the collection of entity ids. The ids are attachment ids (attachment primary key)
GetAttachmentPreview: Retrieve an attachment from ticket message. The returned data is intended to be used for a preview. The returned data is sanitized.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.AttachmentPrevi.description:

EmailTo.description: To field of the attached RFC822 email. Null for non-RFC822 attachment

EmailCc.description: Cc field of the attached RFC822 email. Null for non-RFC822 attachment

EmailDate.description: Date of the attached RFC822 email. Default DateTime value for non-RFC822 attachment

EmailAttachmentsInfo.description: The attachments inside the attached RFC822 email. Empty array for non-RFC822 attachment
